com.fasterxml.storemate.backend.bdbje

Class BDBJEConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.backend.StoreBackendConfig
      • com.fasterxml.storemate.backend.bdbje.BDBJEConfig

  • public class BDBJEConfig
extends StoreBackendConfig
    Simple configuration class for BDB-JE - based backend.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      org.skife.config.DataAmount cacheSize
      Size of BDB-JE cache, in bytes.
      File dataRoot
      Name of root directory (using relative or absolute path) in which metadata database will be created.
      Boolean deferredWritesForEntries
      Should we use deferred writes for entry metadata? Note that use of deferred writes can cause data loss if system crashes; during normal shutdown, sync() will be called if deferred writes are enabled.
      int lockTableCount
      Configuration setting BDB-JE uses for EnvironmentConfig.LOCK_N_LOCK_TABLES setting; BDB defaults to 1, but typically a higher count should make sense.
      int lockTimeoutMsecs
      Length of timeout setting, in milliseconds, for BDB-JE to try to obtain a lock on reading from store.

    • Field Detail

      • dataRoot

        public File dataRoot
        Name of root directory (using relative or absolute path) in which metadata database will be created.

        Should not be same as the directory in which data files are stored (nor the main deployment directory)

      • cacheSize

        public org.skife.config.DataAmount cacheSize
        Size of BDB-JE cache, in bytes. Should be big enough to allow branches to be kept in memory, but not necessarily the whole DB.

        NOTE: most developers think "bigger is better", when it comes to cache sizing. That is patently wrong idea -- too big a cache can kill JVM via GC overhead. So a few megs goes a long way; the most important cache is probably OS block cache for the file system.

        Default value is 50 megs.

      • lockTableCount

        public int lockTableCount
        Configuration setting BDB-JE uses for EnvironmentConfig.LOCK_N_LOCK_TABLES setting; BDB defaults to 1, but typically a higher count should make sense. Let's start with 17; probably not much benefit from super-high value since it ought to be I/O bound.
        Since:
        0.9.5

      • lockTimeoutMsecs

        public int lockTimeoutMsecs
        Length of timeout setting, in milliseconds, for BDB-JE to try to obtain a lock on reading from store. This is per-environment setting so it affects both lookups and by-mod-time iteration.

        Default value of 7 seconds tries to balance requirements between detecting and breaking deadlocks; failing "too slow" operations; and trying to prevent unnecessary failures. Current hypothesis is that this needs to be somewhat higher than what is estimated as the slowest OldGen GC collection; and given baseline of 5 seconds max GC, adding bit of padding, 7 seems reasonable.

        Since:
        0.9.6

      • deferredWritesForEntries

        public Boolean deferredWritesForEntries
        Should we use deferred writes for entry metadata? Note that use of deferred writes can cause data loss if system crashes; during normal shutdown, sync() will be called if deferred writes are enabled.

        Default (of no value) is same as false, meaning that defe

        Since:
        0.9.8
